intro: Decaneurum javanicum, commonly known as the Java fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and spadix inflorescence. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Decaneurum javanicum make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
